Usage¶

Importing the library¶

The main entry points to Q-Materialise live in the top‑level q_materialise package. Upon import the library will locate a suitable Qt binding and provide a set of helper classes in q_materialise.binding which mirror the public API of the underlying binding. In most cases you will not need to interact directly with this module because widgets imported from your binding will work transparently with the stylesheet.

Applying a style¶

To apply a style call inject_style() immediately after creating your QApplication instance. You can pass either the name of a built‑in style or a Style instance.

import sys
from q_materialise import inject_style
from PySide6 import QtWidgets

app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)
# choose one of the built‑in styles, for example a light blue palette
inject_style(app, style="sapphire_day")
main_window = QtWidgets.QMainWindow()
main_window.show()
sys.exit(app.exec())

Listing styles¶

Use list_styles() to get the names of all available built‑in styles at runtime:

from q_materialise import list_styles

print(list_styles())

Loading styles¶

To load one of the built‑in styles as a Style instance call get_style():

from q_materialise import get_style

twilight = get_style("indigo_twilight")
print(twilight.primary)  # e.g. '#3f51b5'

Generating styles¶

You can programmatically generate a new style from a small set of inputs using generate_style().

from q_materialise import generate_style

my_style = generate_style(
    name="my_dark_style",
    primary="#ff5722",
    secondary="#009688",
    is_dark=True,
)

print(my_style.to_dict())

Runtime extras¶

Additional colours and font settings can be supplied via the extra argument of inject_style(). See the documentation of that function for a list of recognised keys. Unknown keys will be silently ignored.

Exporting stylesheets¶

To write the current style to a .qss file use export_style(). This function accepts a Style instance or a style name, a destination path and the same optional extras accepted by inject_style().
